p.s: The problems with the textile industry and what we can do to improve the situation.
The bad situation in the textile industry is very important, but can we do anything and if we do what can we do?
I will answer that in my article.
My source for this article is the interview Fast Fashion: Unser Kleiderkonsum ist Wahnsinn written by JÃ¶rg Oberwittler and published in Spiegel Online on the 21 December 2017.
One problem of the textile industry is that they throw their trash and chemicals into rivers and destroy the enviromentenvironment.
The workers there work ten to twelve hours a day and only have one free day per week.
Besides that the workers develop ana mentality of producing as much as possible even if it hurts them.
A boycott is not the solution because the people there would have no income and the companies would just go to another country.
We should instead support labels who support better working conditions and the government should finally do something against the exploitation of the workers.
In conclusion you should support labels who are for better conditions and try to make the government finally do something.
We should do that because such bad conditions at this time should not be tolerated any longer.
